title: June 10
description:
Felix told Lucie: "You know Mom, I'm not a kid anymore. I'm a pre-teen." Lucie tried to argue otherwise, but Felix is quite firm: "From 10 to 12, you are a pre-teen." Alright then.

Friday after school, the 2nd grade families gathered at Cordonices park for an end-of-the-year picnic. Milo got a little too daring on the long concrete slide and scraped his face. He was fine until someone pointed out he was bleeding from the mouth, whereupon he instantly turned into a blubbering mess. We left in a hurry. It was hours later that we realized where the blood had come from: his front tooth got knocked out of his mouth!

It was a baby tooth and somewhat loose already, so no big deal. Milo wrote a note to the tooth fairy to explain why the tooth is still at the park, complete with an illustration of the epic face plant.

children.title: Literary Award
children.description:
To mark the end of the year, the 4th grade held literary award ceremony in front of their parents.

Each kid (ahem, pre-teen) presented their very own award to their personal favorite book they read this school year.

Felix awarded his "Bestest Book Ever" medal to the final book in the Harry Potter series.

He was more than a little nervous, but got through his speech just fine.

children.title: Not Obama
children.description:
President Obama came to Dean's office!

Dean was otherwise engaged and didn't manage to pencil Mr. President into his schedule, but he definitely had close encounters with the Secret Service. Tip: when they're clearing the streets for the presidential motorcade, don't stick your head out of an 8th floor window.

Instead of a photo of Obama, here's one Dean took of of the Bay Bridge the same day, across the street from his office.

Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff is one of 35 official co-chairs for Obama's re-election campaign. He's the only tech CEO to have received this honor. The responsibility of co-chairs is to help raise money for the campaign fund.

children.title: Sam
children.description:
Milo has a new friend: Sam. They're in the same grade but not the same class. Even though Milo and Sam have been schoolmates for years, they didn't really meet until recently. They play a lot together during recess. This weekend was Sam's first time at our house.

Milo is showing off his missing front teeth and the dollar coin the Tooth Fairy left under his pillow.

Ever since the Post Office stopped handing out change in dollar coins, it's been harder for the Tooth Fairy to make Her payments.

children.title: Planning
children.description:
For weeks now, Felix has been asking to have a few friends over to play a game he invented, called Maze of Monsters. It's a role playing game much like D&D.

Saturday was the Big Day. Felix spent a long time thinking through all the details, discussing possible characters with his friends and preparing the game sheets and the board.

children.title: M of M
children.description:
Players for the very first ever session of Maze of Monsters: Austin, Connor, Peter, Dean, Lucie and Milo.

And of course, the Maze Master himself: Felix.

children.title: Game Pieces
children.description:
The players are represented by Lego minifigs and a magnet monkey (can you guess which Moses was the monkey?).

The pawns are foul-tempered orcs.

children.title: Game Play
children.description:
Connor, Peter and Milo had spent many recesses discussing their characters and special abilities with Felix. They plan on keeping their characters and continuing this M of M campaign.

Connor is a bard that can play magical tunes (some heal, some harm). Peter is a necromancer. Milo is an ape who can hug you to death.

Dean is a cyclops archer. With an eye patch. Since cyclops' don't have much depth perception to begin with, the loss of the eye was no real big deal. He instead uses the Force. Unfortunately he also has a tin ear for the Force, so things often go badly awry.

children.title: Battle
children.description: The game went surprisingly well. The pace was good, Felix kept track of all the details and we finished our adventure in the allotted time. The players are clamoring for more.

children.title: Swimming
children.description:
Summertime's here.

Sunny Sunday at the pool with August and Ulysses.

children.title: Pool
children.description: Watch out, he is hiding a water gun below the surface.
